main event: A ground-radar observation in Sunburst, Montana on 6th December 1957 reported a round silver ball traveling very fast for approximately 5 minutes.
interesting points: The sighting was made using ground-radar and binoculars.
The report includes photographs of the object.
The conclusion was that it was possibly a balloon or astronomical in nature, but with insufficient information to confirm.
The report was considered a 'worthless report' and 'insufficient.'
The observation lasted for 5 minutes, indicating a prolonged sighting of the object.
sighted object: round silver ball traveling very fast
